events.name: focus
events.summary: Fired when this tab group gains focus. On Android, fired when a tab in this tab group gains focus.
events.description: On Android, this event also fires when the activity enters the foreground (after the activity enters the resume state).

properties.name: index
properties.summary: Index of the current active tab.

properties.name: previousIndex
properties.summary: Index of the previous active tab.

properties.name: tab
properties.summary: Active tab.

properties.name: previousTab
properties.summary: Previous active tab.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: androidback
events.summary: Fired when the back button is pressed by the user.
events.description:
This event is fired when the current tab group's activity detects a back button press by the user to navigate back.

By default this event would trigger the current activity to be finished and removed from the task stack. Subscribing to this event with a listener will prevent the default behavior. To finish the activity from your listener just call the close method of the tab group.

events.name: androidcamera
events.summary: Fired when the Camera button is released.
events.description: Setting a listener disables the default key handling for this button. To restore default behavior, remove the listener.

events.name: androidfocus
events.summary: Fired when the Camera button is half-pressed then released.
events.description: Setting a listener disables the default key handling for this button. To restore default behavior, remove the listener.

events.name: androidsearch
events.summary: Fired when the Search button is released.
events.description: Setting a listener disables the default key handling for this button. To restore default behavior, remove the listener.

events.name: androidvoldown
events.summary: Fired when the volume down button is released.
events.description: Setting a listener disables the default key handling for this button. To restore default behavior, remove the listener.

events.name: androidvolup
events.summary: Fired when the volume up button is released.
events.description: Setting a listener disables the default key handling for this button. To restore default behavior, remove the listener.

events.name: close
events.summary: Fired when the tab group is closed.

events.name: open
events.summary: Fired when the tab group is opened.
events.description: The listener for this event must be defined before this window is opened.

events.name: blur
events.summary: Fired when this tab group loses focus. On Android, fired when a tab in this tab group loses focus.
events.description: On Android, this event also fires before putting the activity in the background (before the activity enters the pause state).

properties.name: index
properties.summary: Index of the current active tab. On iOS, a value of undefined indicates that the More tab was the active tab.

properties.name: previousIndex
properties.summary: Index of the previous active tab. On iOS, a value of undefined indicates that the More tab was the previous tab.

properties.name: tab
properties.summary: Active tab.

properties.name: previousTab
properties.summary: Previous active tab. On iOS, a value of undefined indicates that the More tab was the previous tab.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

properties.name: index
properties.summary: Index of the current active tab.

properties.name: previousIndex
properties.summary: Index of the previous active tab.

properties.name: tab
properties.summary: Active tab.

properties.name: previousTab
properties.summary: Previous active tab.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

properties.name: index
properties.summary: Index of the current active tab. On iOS, a value of undefined indicates that the More tab was the active tab.

properties.name: previousIndex
properties.summary: Index of the previous active tab. On iOS, a value of undefined indicates that the More tab was the previous tab.

properties.name: tab
properties.summary: Active tab.

properties.name: previousTab
properties.summary: Previous active tab. On iOS, a value of undefined indicates that the More tab was the previous tab.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

methods.name: addTab
methods.summary: Adds a tab to the tab group.

methods.name: close
methods.summary: Closes the tab group and removes it from the UI.

parameters.name: params
parameters.summary: Animation or display properties to use when closing the window.

returns.summary: Starting in SDK 10.0.0, this method returns a Promise that will be resolved once the window is closed, akin to adding a one-time listener for the close event. If the window fails to close (for example, because it was not yet open) the Promise will be rejected.

methods.name: disableTabNavigation
methods.summary: Disable (or re-enable) tab navigation. If tab navigation is disabled, the tabs are hidden and the last selected tab window is shown.

parameters.name: disable
parameters.summary: True to disable tab navigation, false to re-enable the tabs.

methods.name: getTabs
methods.summary: Gets all tabs that are managed by the tab group.

methods.name: open
methods.summary: Opens the tab group and makes it visible.

parameters.name: params
parameters.summary: Animation or display properties to use when opening the window.

returns.summary: Starting in SDK 10.0.0, this method returns a Promise that will be resolved once the window is opened, akin to adding a one-time listener for the open event. If the window fails to open (for example, because it is already opened or opening) the Promise will be rejected.

methods.name: removeTab
methods.summary: Removes a tab from the tab group.

methods.name: setActiveTab
methods.summary: Selects the currently active tab in a tab group.

parameters.name: indexOrObject
parameters.summary: Index or object of the tab to switch to.

properties.name: activeTab
properties.summary: Active tab.

properties.name: activeTabBackgroundImage
properties.summary: Default background image for the active tab.

properties.name: activeTabIconTint
properties.summary: Color applied to active tabs icons, as a color name or hex triplet, where the tab's activeIcon was not defined.
properties.description: For information about color values, see the "Colors" section of Titanium.UI.

properties.name: activeTintColor
properties.summary: The activeTintColor to apply to tabs.
properties.description: This property affects the tint of selected tab icons.

properties.name: activeTitleColor
properties.summary: Defines the color of the title of tab when it's active.
properties.description: The color of the title of the tab when it's active.

properties.name: activity
properties.summary: Reference to the Android Activity object associated with this tab group.
properties.description:
An Activity object is not created until the tab group opens. Before the tab group opens, activity refers to an empty JavaScript object. You can set properties on this object but cannot invoke any Activity methods on it. Once the tab group opens, the actual Activity object is created, using any properties set on the JavaScript object. At this point, you can call methods on the activity and access any properties that are set when the activity is created.

Prior to Release 3.4.0, you can only set properties on the activity after the tab group opens.

properties.name: allowUserCustomization
properties.summary: Allow the user to reorder tabs in the tab group using the Edit button on the More tab.
properties.description: Set to false to prevent tab reordering.

properties.name: barColor
properties.summary: Default navigation bar color (typically for the More tab), as a color name or hex triplet.
properties.description:
For information about color values, see the "Colors" section of Titanium.UI.

A value of transparent results in a semi-opaque black bar style.

properties.name: editButtonTitle
properties.summary: Title for the edit button on the More tab.

properties.name: exitOnClose
properties.summary: Boolean value indicating if the application should exit when closing the tab group, whether via Android back button or the close method.
properties.description: Starting in 3.4.2 you can set this property at any time. In earlier releases you can only set this as a createTabGroup({...}) option.
properties.default: True if tab group is opened on top of the root activity. False otherwise.

properties.name: navTintColor
properties.summary: The tintColor to apply to the navigation bar (typically for the More tab).
properties.description: This property is a direct correspondant of the tintColor property of NavigationBar on iOS.

properties.name: paddingBottom
properties.summary: Bottom padding of bottom navigation
properties.description: When using TABS_STYLE_BOTTOM_NAVIGATION you can set the padding to have a floating bottom navigation

properties.name: paddingLeft
properties.summary: Left padding of bottom navigation
properties.description: When using TABS_STYLE_BOTTOM_NAVIGATION you can set the padding to have a floating bottom navigation

properties.name: paddingRight
properties.summary: Right padding of bottom navigation
properties.description: When using TABS_STYLE_BOTTOM_NAVIGATION you can set the padding to have a floating bottom navigation

properties.name: shadowImage
properties.summary: Image of the shadow placed between the tab bar and the content area.
properties.description: The tabsBackgroundImage property must also be set in order for this to take effect.

properties.name: shiftMode
properties.summary: Determines whether the TABS_STYLE_BOTTOM_NAVIGATION uses shiftMode.
properties.description:
In Android BottomNavigationView uses shiftMode by default. This mode changes unselected tabs' properties - makes the title invisible and reduces the icon's dimensions by half.

This property allows the user to choose whether they would use this design behavior.

NOTE: This property only affects TabGroups with the TABS_STYLE_BOTTOM_NAVIGATION.

properties.name: smoothScrollOnTabClick
properties.summary: Boolean value indicating if changing pages by tab clicks is animated.
properties.description: If true, when clicking the tab the page transition is animated, false otherwise.

properties.name: style
properties.summary: Property defining which style for the TabGroup to be used.
properties.description:
Since 8.0.0 Titanium has introduce a new style to be used for the TabGroup component.

For backwards compatibility not taking advantage of this property results in using the default style which is similar to the ActionBar Tabs style but sticking to the Material design Guidelines.

TABS_STYLE_DEFAULT is the style that was used in Titanium prior to 8.0.0.GA. It displays the TabGroup with a list of Tabs at the top of the screen.

TABS_STYLE_BOTTOM_NAVIGATION is a style that displays the TabGroup with a list of Tabs in a controller at the bottom of the screen. The recommended usage of this style is for items count between three and five: (https://material.io/design/components/bottom-navigation.html#usage) In Android it is limited to supporting a maximum number of five tabs. You can use paddingLeft, paddingRight, paddingBottom to create a floating bottom navigation. If you want to change the radius or background color you'll need to create /app/platform/android/res/drawable/titanium_rounded_corners.xml and set it to

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<shape xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android">
    <solid android:color="#FFFFFF" />
    <corners android:radius="7dp" />
</shape>

properties.name: swipeable
properties.summary: Boolean value indicating if tab navigation can be done by swipes, in addition to tab clicks.
properties.description: On Android, the tabs may be selected by swipes, in addition to clicks. This property may be set at tab group creation, or any time later as long as the tab navigation is not disabled.

properties.name: tabs
properties.summary: Tabs managed by the tab group.

properties.name: tabsBackgroundColor
properties.summary: Default background color for inactive tabs, as a color name or hex triplet.
properties.description:
For information about color values, see the "Colors" section of Titanium.UI.

A tab's backgroundColor property takes precedence if set.

This property applies to all states and tabs, not just inactive tabs. Furthermore, the inactive tab icons without activeIcon will be tinted this color.

properties.name: tabsBackgroundImage
properties.summary: Default background image for tabs.

properties.name: tabsBackgroundSelectedColor
properties.summary: Default background selected color for tabs, as a color name or hex triplet.
properties.description:
For information about color values, see the "Colors" section of Titanium.UI.

This property is only supported by TABS_STYLE_BOTTOM_NAVIGATION.

A tab's backgroundFocusedColor property takes precedence if set.

properties.name: tabsTintColor
properties.summary: The tintColor to apply to the tabs.
properties.description: This property is a direct correspondant of the tintColor property of UITabBar on iOS. This effects the title and icons rendered in the active tab. When not specified the active icons are tinted with a bright blue.

properties.name: tabsTranslucent
properties.summary: A Boolean value that indicates whether the tab bar is translucent.
properties.description:
When the value of this property is true, the tab group adds a translucent effect to its background image or tint color. When translucency is enabled, part of the tab bar's underlying content is able to show through, although the amount that shows through depends on the rest of the tab bar configuration. For example, a background image can wholly or partially obscure the background content. Setting this property to NO causes the tab bar to render its bar tint color or background image on top of an opaque backdrop.

The default value of this property is dependent on the configuration of the tab bar:

  • The default value is true when the tab bar does not have a custom background image.
  • The default value is true when a custom background image contains any transparency - that is, at least one pixel has an alpha value of less than 1.0.
  • The default value is false when the custom background image is completely opaque - that is, all pixels have an alpha value of 1.0.

properties.name: tintColor
properties.summary: The tintColor to apply to tabs.
properties.description: This property affects the tint of unselected tab icons.

properties.name: title
properties.summary: Title for this tabGroup.

properties.name: titleAttributes
properties.summary: Title text attributes of the window to be applied on the More tab.
properties.description: Use this property to specify the color, font and shadow attributes of the title.

properties.name: titleColor
properties.summary: Defines the color of the title of tab when it's inactive.
properties.description: The color of the title of the tab when it's inactive.

properties.name: translucent
properties.summary: Boolean value indicating if the nav bar (typically for the More tab), is translucent.
properties.default: true on iOS7 and above, false otherwise.

properties.name: unselectedItemTintColor
properties.summary: Unselected items in this tab group will be tinted with this color. Setting this value to null indicates that the tab group should use its default value instead.
properties.description: For information about color values, see the "Colors" section of Titanium.UI.

properties.name: windowSoftInputMode
properties.summary: Determines how the tab group is treated when a soft input method (such as a virtual keyboard) is displayed.
properties.description: For more information see the official Android API Reference, Window.setSoftInputMode.
properties.examples:
# Examples

# Soft Input Visibility and Adjustment

Create a white window and respond to a click of it to open a red window containing a text area. Show the software keyboard automatically as the red window opens.

var win1 = Ti.UI.createWindow({
  backgroundColor: 'white',
  exitOnClose: true,
  fullscreen: false,
  title: 'Click window to test'
});

// use bitwise OR to combine two settings for the windowSoftInputMode property
var softInput = Ti.UI.Android.SOFT_INPUT_STATE_ALWAYS_VISIBLE | Ti.UI.Android.SOFT_INPUT_ADJUST_PAN;

win1.addEventListener('click', function(){
var win2 = Ti.UI.createWindow({
  backgroundColor: 'red',
  fullscreen: false,
  windowSoftInputMode: softInput
});

var textArea = Ti.UI.createTextArea({
  value : 'I am a textarea',
  height : 200,
  width : 300,
  top : 200
});
win2.add(textArea);
win2.open();
});

win1.open();
